verses.kjv: Now we beseech you, brethren, by the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, and by our gathering together unto him,
verses.web: Now, brothers, concerning the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ and our gathering together to him, we ask you
verses.ct: Now, brothers and sisters, regarding the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ and our being gathered together to meet him, we have something to ask of you.

verses.kjv: That ye be not soon shaken in mind, or be troubled, neither by spirit, nor by word, nor by letter as from us, as that the day of Christ is at hand.
verses.web: not to be quickly shaken in your mind, and not be troubled, either by spirit, or by word, or by letter as if from us, saying that the day of Christ has already come.
verses.ct: Don't let yourselves be easily shaken or thrown into panic — whether by some supposed prophecy, or by something someone said, or by a letter claiming to be from us — suggesting that the day of Christ has already arrived.

verses.kjv: Let no man deceive you by any means: for that day shall not come, except there come a falling away first, and that man of sin be revealed, the son of perdition;
verses.web: Let no one deceive you in any way. For it will not be, unless the rebellion comes first, and the man of sin is revealed, the son of destruction,
verses.ct: Don't let anyone deceive you in any way. That day will not come until there is a great rebellion against God first, and the man of sin is revealed — the one destined for destruction.

verses.kjv: Who opposeth and exalteth himself above all that is called God, or that is worshipped; so that he as God sitteth in the temple of God, shewing himself that he is God.
verses.web: he who opposes and exalts himself against all that is called God or that is worshiped, so that he sits as God in the temple of God, setting himself up as God.
verses.ct: He will oppose and exalt himself above everything that is called God or worshiped, even going so far as to sit in God's temple and declare himself to be God.

verses.kjv: Remember ye not, that, when I was yet with you, I told you these things?
verses.web: Don’t you remember that, when I was still with you, I told you these things?
verses.ct: Don't you remember? I told you all of this when I was still with you.

verses.kjv: And now ye know what withholdeth that he might be revealed in his time.
verses.web: Now you know what is restraining him, to the end that he may be revealed in his own season.
verses.ct: You already know what is holding him back right now, so that he will be revealed only when his time comes.

verses.kjv: For the mystery of iniquity doth already work: only he who now letteth will let, until he be taken out of the way.
verses.web: For the mystery of lawlessness already works. Only there is one who restrains now, until he is taken out of the way.
verses.ct: The mystery of lawlessness is already at work in the world. But the one who is currently restraining it will continue to do so until he is removed.

verses.kjv: And then shall that Wicked be revealed, whom the Lord shall consume with the spirit of his mouth, and shall destroy with the brightness of his coming:
verses.web: Then the lawless one will be revealed, whom the Lord will kill with the breath of his mouth, and destroy by the manifestation of his coming;
verses.ct: Then the lawless one will be revealed — and the Lord Jesus will destroy him with the breath of his mouth and wipe him out by the sheer brilliance of his coming.

verses.kjv: Even him, whose coming is after the working of Satan with all power and signs and lying wonders,
verses.web: even he whose coming is according to the working of Satan with all power and signs and lying wonders,
verses.ct: This lawless one will come with the full power of Satan behind him, performing every kind of counterfeit miracle, sign, and wonder.

verses.kjv: And with all deceivableness of unrighteousness in them that perish; because they received not the love of the truth, that they might be saved.
verses.web: and with all deception of wickedness for those who are being lost, because they didn’t receive the love of the truth, that they might be saved.
verses.ct: He will use every form of wicked deception on those who are perishing — people who refused to love the truth that could have saved them.

verses.kjv: And for this cause God shall send them strong delusion, that they should believe a lie:
verses.web: Because of this, God sends them a working of error, that they should believe a lie;
verses.ct: Because of this, God will send them a powerful delusion so that they will believe the lie.

verses.kjv: That they all might be damned who believed not the truth, but had pleasure in unrighteousness.
verses.web: that they all might be judged who didn’t believe the truth, but had pleasure in unrighteousness.
verses.ct: The result is that everyone who refused to believe the truth and instead took pleasure in wickedness will be condemned.

verses.kjv: But we are bound to give thanks alway to God for you, brethren beloved of the Lord, because God hath from the beginning chosen you to salvation through sanctification of the Spirit and belief of the truth:
verses.web: But we are bound to always give thanks to God for you, brothers loved by the Lord, because God chose you from the beginning for salvation through sanctification of the Spirit and belief in the truth,
verses.ct: But we always have reason to thank God for you, brothers and sisters loved by the Lord, because from the very beginning God chose you for salvation through the sanctifying work of the Holy Spirit and your belief in the truth.

verses.kjv: Whereunto he called you by our gospel, to the obtaining of the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.web: to which he called you through our Good News, for the obtaining of the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: He called you to this through the good news we preached, so that you would share in the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: Therefore, brethren, stand fast, and hold the traditions which ye have been taught, whether by word, or our epistle.
verses.web: So then, brothers, stand firm and hold the traditions which you were taught by us, whether by word or by letter.
verses.ct: So then, brothers and sisters, stand firm and hold on to the teachings we passed on to you, whether we gave them to you in person or by letter.

verses.kjv: Now our Lord Jesus Christ himself, and God, even our Father, which hath loved us, and hath given us everlasting consolation and good hope through grace,
verses.web: Now our Lord Jesus Christ himself, and God our Father, who loved us and gave us eternal comfort and good hope through grace,
verses.ct: May our Lord Jesus Christ himself, and God our Father — who loved us and by his grace gave us eternal comfort and a wonderful hope —

verses.kjv: Comfort your hearts, and stablish you in every good word and work.
verses.web: comfort your hearts and establish you in every good work and word.
verses.ct: encourage your hearts and strengthen you in every good thing you do and say.
